items.title: FINEance
items.description: An app and website to educate Dartmouth students on personal finance by meal plan management guidance. Features real-time updating through Dartmouth ITC. A collaboration between the Women in Science Project and the DALI Lab.

items.title: GreenTrace
items.description: Contact tracing and notification system for Dartmouth College. Final project for CS52: Full-Stack Web Development.

items.title: IPA Picker
items.description: International Phonetic Alphabet character picker for phonetic transcription. Useful for linguistics.

items.title: Full-Stack Blog
items.description: Full-stack blog created with React, Redux, Express, and MongoDB. Includes comments, search functionality, and authentication. Created for CS52: Full-Stack Web Development.

items.title: React Notes
items.description: Collaborative note board featuring real-time editing, optional authentication, and the ability to create, update, and delete posts. Created for CS52: Full-Stack Web Development.

items.title: Tiny Search Engine
items.description: Command-line search engine in C. Consists of a crawler, an indexer, and a querier (using keyword matching to rank pages). Created for CS50: Software Design and Implementation.

items.title: Mudras
items.description: iOS application to teach Indian classical dance students necessary hand gestures (mudras).

sections.subheader: I'm a '23 at Dartmouth College from Newton, MA. I'm interested in computer science, human-centered design, and linguistics.

items.title: Women in Science Project at the DALI Lab
items.description: Building FINEance: an app and website to educate Dartmouth students on personal finance by meal plan management guidance. Features real-time updating through Dartmouth ITC.

items.title: Dartmouth Academic Skills Center
items.description: Peer academic tutor for CS 10: Object-Oriented Programming. Clarifying concepts and helping with labs.

items.title: Man Numeric
items.description: Internship at a quantitative financial firm. Environmental, Social, and Governance research; Alternative Risk Premia research; and programming a test quality alpha factor and unit tests.

items.title: Newton Free Library
items.description: Volunteered at local public library. Ran math club for children from kindergarten through second grade. Helped out with design, shelving, and activity planning in Children's Room.

items.title: Triveni School of Dance
items.description: Taught three styles of Indian classical dance (Bharatanatyam, Kuchipudi, and Odissi) to dancers of ages four to sixty-four for six to twelve hours a week.

sections.subheader:
I'm a '23 at Dartmouth College from Newton, MA. 
I'm currently studying computer science, human-centered design, and linguistics. I'm extremely interested in tech for social good.
I'm proficient in JavaScript, Java, Python, C, React Native, HTML, CSS, REST APIs, Express, and MongoDB, and I've dabbled in Swift and with Firebase, too!
When I'm not coding, you can find me dancing, writing, or reading!
Fun fact: I'm clumsy enough to fall up the stairs at least once every week, but I'm agile enough to dance while balancing on the rim of a brass plate!
